name: A Measure of Valor
description: Tales have spread across the galaxy that the crew of the USS Phoenix was killed, save for one brave soul who somehow managed to fight off the intruders. Starfleet needs you to find the Phoenix and solve the mystery of its now legendary hero.
rules:
-- In this Hybrid Event, you will complete Federation, Bajoran, or Klingon Faction Missions in one Phase, and Ship Battles in another Phase.
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- Unique Ship Battles and Faction Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Li Nalas, Lavelle, Mudd, Mavericks, or crew with the matching battle trait will provide a bonus to Ship Battles and Faction Missions.
-- Using the U.S.S Phoenix, Generational NX-01, or the Miranda Class will provide a hull bonus in Skirmish Battles.
-- Every Ship Battle or Faction Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Li Nalas, Lavelle, Mudd or Mavericks
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Missions!

featured_crew.name: O'Brien
featured_crew.flavor: Chief O'Brien is strongly determined to beat Doctor Bashir at racquetball.

action.name: I Can Play Any Style You Like

featured_crew.name: Sam
featured_crew.flavor: Lavelle was career-oriented and driven and most wanted a promotion

action.name: Aye, Aye, Sir!

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

content.reroll_info:
Skirmish rewards are additive. By continuously rolling you receive additional rewards. No rewards are lost by rolling again.
DROP RATES:
Event VP: 13.58%
Time Portal Pack: 0.13%
Chronitons: 11.45%
Honor: 14.11%
Intel: 27.43%
Credits: 33.29%

Intel: 27.43%

actions.name: Précision + Réduction des dégâts de la coque
Précision + Réduction des dégâts de la coque
Précision + Réduction des dégâts de la coque

goals.flavor: Learn of the Phoenix's valor with the Federation.
Help the Bajorans learn of the Phoenix's history.
Show the Phoenix's honor to the Klingon Empire.

screens.text: "Hey Captain, you hear the story floating around? About the missing starship and her one-man crew? Apparently the ship was boarded and the entire crew slaughtered, except for one guy who turned the tide and fought off the intruders."

"Somehow, he managed to keep the ship going, but has yet to make it back. Can you imagine one man piloting an entire starship? Fighting off all those attackers? If he made it back, he'd be a Starfleet hero!"
"Absolutely preposterous, all of it. And these rumors aren't harmless galactic folklore. Far too many crews have gone in search of this vessel and none have returned."

"Now who's telling tales? I'm sure the Captain here is interested. Aren't you, Captain? Go check it out. Maybe, if you manage to bring the missing ship and survivor back, you'll be a hero in your own right."

"Hey Captain, you hear the story floating around? About the missing starship and her one-man crew? Apparently the ship was boarded and the entire crew slaughtered, except for one guy who turned the tide and fought off the intruders."

"Somehow, he managed to keep the ship going, but has yet to make it back. Can you imagine one man piloting an entire starship? Fighting off all those attackers? If he made it back, he'd be a Starfleet hero!"
"Absolutely preposterous, all of it. And these rumors aren't harmless galactic folklore. Far too many crews have gone in search of this vessel and none have returned."

"Now who's telling tales? I'm sure the Captain here is interested. Aren't you, Captain? Go check it out. Maybe, if you manage to bring the missing ship and survivor back, you'll be a hero in your own right."

"Looks like all that running around you did paid off, Captain. With what you brought back to Starfleet, we were able to figure out that someone's controlling the Phoenix remotely and we've just made contact. Now who is this and what do you want with the Phoenix?"
"I suppose there's no use keeping quiet, especially if you're going to keep hailing and shouting like that. Harcourt Fentin Mudd's the name and intergalactic business ventures are my game!"
"Mudd!? How did you come into possession of a Starfleet vessel? What happened to the crew and those who went searching? Was it you who spread all those rumors?"

responses.text: "What would you want with the Phoenix? How did you gain control of it?"
"Return the Phoenix to Starfleet and surrender yourself."
"What happened to the crew? Was that sole-survivor story even real?"

screens.text: "Whoa, those are a lot of questions, Navarch, and I don't hear you offering any latinum to loosen my lips."
"A smooth Nebula-class like this, Captain? Who wouldn't want one? They just don't make 'em like this anymore. But your people really should change those prefix codes more often."
"Captain, you really think I'm going to surrender? Not when the Phoenix and I have so much left to do. And this ship's nacelles alone could finance my retirement."
"I solely survived the encounter. Don't I count, Captain? Though to be fair, it did take a little fudging of temporal physics to make that happen."

"Well, folks, I'm a busy man. If you've nothing to offer me, I'll be on my way. If you want the Phoenix back, you can try and take it back, though it would be a shame for you to meet the same fate as those who failed before you."

"Looks like all that running around you did paid off, Captain. With what you brought back to Starfleet, we were able to figure out that someone's controlling the Phoenix remotely and we've just made contact. Now who is this and what do you want with the Phoenix?"
"I suppose there's no use keeping quiet, especially if you're going to keep hailing and shouting like that. Harcourt Fentin Mudd's the name and intergalactic business ventures are my game!"
"Mudd!? How did you come into possession of a Starfleet vessel? What happened to the crew and those who went searching? Was it you who spread all those rumors?"

responses.text: "What would you want with the Phoenix? How did you gain control of it?"
"Return the Phoenix to Starfleet and surrender yourself."
"What happened to the crew? Was that sole-survivor story even real?"

screens.text: "Whoa, those are a lot of questions, Navarch, and I don't hear you offering any latinum to loosen my lips."
"A smooth Nebula-class like this, Captain? Who wouldn't want one? They just don't make 'em like this anymore. But your people really should change those prefix codes more often."
"Captain, you really think I'm going to surrender? Not when the Phoenix and I have so much left to do. And this ship's nacelles alone could finance my retirement."
"I solely survived the encounter. Don't I count, Captain? Though to be fair, it did take a little fudging of temporal physics to make that happen."

"Well, folks, I'm a busy man. If you've nothing to offer me, I'll be on my way. If you want the Phoenix back, you can try and take it back, though it would be a shame for you to meet the same fate as those who failed before you."
